skillTree.localised_description: Blood everywhere and fatal wounds. There's no walking away from this.
Some warriors care not for their own personal safety, and so work themselves into a whirlwind of destruction and mindless violence!

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: Looking absolutely hideous is a distinct advantage if you actually want others to be afraid of you.
As a Bull Centaur ages, their flesh hardens like metal – harder to hurt, quicker to heal, and better at resisting magical attack.
The Father of Darkness protects his children from sorcery through a variety of magical means, all of them twisted and obscure.
Having a thing for hats can be most useful when everyone keeps aiming at your head…
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: This Herald advances with bitter resolve and, by his example, his followers do the same.
The Herald is an iron bulwark of implacable tenacity. Under his threatening gaze his warriors will hold any and all available positions, holstering them against enemy counter-attack.

effects.description:
Missile Resistance: +3% for all Artillery and Flying Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +4 for Chaos Dwarf and Bull Centaur units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +3% for K'Daai Fireborn, K'Daai Destroyer, Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resistance: +7% for all Artillery and Flying Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for Chaos Dwarf and Bull Centaur units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +7% for K'Daai Fireborn, K'Daai Destroyer, Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resistance: +10% for all Artillery and Flying Monster units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +8 for Chaos Dwarf and Bull Centaur units
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +10% for K'Daai Fireborn, K'Daai Destroyer, Skullcracker units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in Hashut's name.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
When a heavily defended position needs nothing short of ceaseless firepower, this Herald will deliver.
Clog up their guns with the flesh and bones of the weak.

Reload Time Reduction: +3% for all Labourer and Hobgoblin ranged units

Melee Defence: +10 for all Labourer and Hobgoblin melee units

skillTree.localised_description: The Chaos Dwarfs unflinchingly face their fate, drawing upon millennia of resolve and hate to weather the most punishing of attacks.

skillTree.localised_description: With meticulous firepower do the Chaos Dwarfs prevail.

skillTree.localised_description: The Father of Darkness gives strength to these beings, the ones that resemble the most his own majestic and terrifying form.

skillTree.localised_description: This Herald has an innate understanding of the relationship between the Daemon and the machine, and will use this to its full potential on the battlefield.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The corrupted daemon engines of the Chaos Dwarfs refuse to yield.

Melee Defence: +3 for K'Daai Fireborn, K'Daai Destroyer, Skullcracker units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even though they're considered little more than a raw resource by their evil masters, some Greenskins avoid being worked to death by "assisting" their keepers on the field of battle.

effects.description:
Speed: +10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Hobgoblins  and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for Labourers, Hobgoblins and Hobgoblin Wolf Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To be this effective in battle takes not just suicidal levels of courage and determination, but the discipline to hold the line and, as one, take the fight directly into the enemy's wavering hearts.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Chaos Dwarf melee infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Chaos Dwarf Melee Infantry units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: From the barrels of the Chaos Dwarfs' infernal war machines are fired shrieking rockets and blasts of raw, Ruinous magick, leaving those not instantly turned to liquid quaking and gibbering in their wake.

effects.description:
Explosive Missile Damage: +8% for Iron Daemon and Artillery units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +8% for Iron Daemon, Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +10% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Iron Daemon and Artillery, Chaos Dwarf Blunderbusses and Infernal Guard (Fireglaives) units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those twisted, hellishly-mutated monsters in the service of the Chaos Dwarfs are some of their most effective weapons, particularly when organised into a malign host of Ruinous shock troops.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +8% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Bull Centaur Renders, Great Taurus, Lammasu, Bale Taurus, K'daai and Skullcracker units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Beatings WILL continue until morale improves, or even if it does...
Some conquerors are mild and fair. Not so this one, whose savagery and corruption truly know no bounds.
A Dawi-Zharr such as he does not care for being wounded – by his will alone he continues to fight.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Underway: +10%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them – this is what Chaos wants.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die. There is no other option."
Brutality or viciousness don't go anywhere near far enough. Even barbarism is too mild a term.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases by each enemy unit in range with leadership wavering or lower.
Entities cannot die while ability is active

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one's pent-up rage makes him an even more fiercesome adversary than he looks.
Forensic and well-versed in strategy and tactics, this one is truly a formidable opponent.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for Chaos Dwarf Heroes
	(factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: To say he is "up for a scrap" is a colossal understatement. In fact, you'd better bring you’re A-game if you find yourself facing this one on the battlefield.
Spite is every bit as spikey as a great big mace covered in spikes, in the right – or rather wrong – hands.
This one commands fire the way others wield swords. He's mad, bad and supremely dangerous to know – even for his own side!
You can't trust this one any further than you can throw him, and believe me, you'd struggle to even pick him up, so slippery is he…
There are those who live for battle and risk death at every turn. Not so, this one, who is more than apprehensive when faced with the fray.
Some would call them hasty, others dynamic and valiant, for this one acts on impulse, before the enemy have a chance to react.
There's pride, and then there's self-regarding, narcissistic vainglory. Not a good look.
Whatever you've got is what this one wants, and the more enchanted, the better.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +20%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Kill them all and keep the loot for yourself. It's not a negative quality to be acquisitive as, after all, it's a material world, no?
You'd think he was the only one ever to have achieved something, the way he goes on about every little victory.
No one likes him, but he really couldn't care less. He has an extremely thick skin, figuratively and literally, it seems.
Pride is supposed to come before a fall, but thus far, this one has not lived up to that proverb.
This one believes themselves to be better than others in every respect, and acts accordingly at every given opportunity.
Having spent a considerable period banished from their own lands, this one had the time to reflect and improve on their many shortcomings.
Parsimonious to say the least, this one never wants to shell out on the best that money can buy.
Get in there, get bloody, get the job done – as soon as possible. Dallying's for losers.
I'm not saying this one's heading for a fall, but… well, yes, actually I am saying that.
Me, me, me, mine, mine, mine – that just about somes up this one's attitude to, well, everything, really.
Stoic and calm, this one is never anything less than totally in control.
It should be obvious that literally never being in a good mood is going to make one that little bit more brutal in melee.
Backhanders – hell, fronthanders, even, so unscrupulous is he.
"Do we have to? Urgh, how tedious…"
The lives of others mean nothing to this abject psycho, and neither does their property. If it's not nailed down, or even if it is, it's fair game to him.
